academic.example: The researcher conducted a comprehensive analysis of the survey results.

academic.definition: A way of dealing with something
academic.example: We need a different approach to solve this problem.

academic.definition: An abstract idea or general notion
academic.example: The concept of democracy is widely accepted.

academic.definition: The circumstances that form the setting for an event, statement, or idea
academic.example: It's important to understand the historical context of the novel.

academic.definition: Facts and statistics collected for reference or analysis
academic.example: The research is based on data collected over five years.

academic.definition: To assess or judge the value or quality of something
academic.example: We need to evaluate the results of the experiment.

academic.definition: A circumstance, fact, or influence that contributes to a result
academic.example: Cost is an important factor in making this decision.

academic.definition: A particular procedure for accomplishing or approaching something
academic.example: This method of teaching has proven very effective.

academic.definition: A fundamental truth or proposition that serves as the foundation for a system of belief
academic.example: The principle of equality is enshrined in our constitution.

academic.definition: The systematic investigation into and study of materials and sources
academic.example: She conducted extensive research before writing her book.

professional.definition: To work jointly with others on an activity or project
professional.example: Our team will collaborate with the marketing department on this campaign.

professional.definition: To put a decision, plan, or system into effect
professional.example: We will implement the new policy next month.

professional.definition: A list of items to be discussed at a meeting
professional.example: The first item on the agenda is the budget review.

professional.definition: An estimate of income and expenditure for a set period of time
professional.example: The department has exceeded its annual budget.

professional.definition: The latest time or date by which something should be completed
professional.example: The project deadline is next Friday.

professional.definition: The ability to assess and initiate things independently
professional.example: She showed great initiative by starting the project without being asked.

professional.definition: To try to reach an agreement by discussion
professional.example: We need to negotiate better terms for the contract.

professional.definition: A goal or aim that efforts are directed towards
professional.example: Our main objective is to increase sales by 10%.

professional.definition: A plan of action designed to achieve a long-term or overall aim
professional.example: The company's marketing strategy has been very successful.

professional.definition: To entrust a task or responsibility to another person
professional.example: A good manager knows when to delegate tasks to team members.

everyday.definition: To recognize the full worth of something
everyday.example: I really appreciate your help with this project.
Please consider all options before making a decision.

everyday.definition: To grow or cause to grow and become more mature or advanced
To set up or create something that will last
everyday.example: They established a new business last year.
Solar panels generate electricity from sunlight.

everyday.definition: To point out or show something
everyday.example: The results indicate a positive trend.

everyday.definition: To keep in good condition or continue to have
everyday.example: It's important to maintain regular exercise habits.
The accident occurred at the intersection.
There has been a significant improvement in her work.
Please give me specific examples of what you mean.
